resources.string: Copper ore can be mined over the entire surface of the Moon using a Mining Drill and some asteroids. The copper ore can be transformed into a copper bar by smelting it in an arc furnace or furnace. Copper ore can also be combined with an equal amount of nickel ore in the furnace to form
Silicon Ore is mined on the entire surface of the Moon using the Mining Drill.
Nickel ore is extracted over the entire surface of the Moon using a mining drill.

Nickel ore can be transformed into nickel ingot by melting it in the furnace or arc furnace. You can use the scale to create a Constantan bar, engulfing it with copper in a ratio of 1: 1 in the furnace.
The smelting of one nickel ore produces the following gases:
The lead ore can be melted into lead bars by placing it in the Arc Furnace or Furnace. It can also be combined with equal amounts of iron ore in the furnace to form solder ingots.
The lead ore is mined over the entire surface of the Moon using a mining drill.
The smelting of one lead ore produces the following gases:
Silver ore is mined over the entire surface of the Moon using the Mining Drill.
It can be transformed into a silver bar by smelting it in an oven or in an arc furnace. Silver ore can be combined with equal amounts of gold ore in the furnace to create an Electrum bar.
The smelting of one silver ore produces the following gases:
Uranium ore is mined over the entire surface of the Moon using a mining rig.
At present, it seems that it does not apply to uranium.
The ore (coal) is mined on the entire surface of the Moon or asteroids using the Mining Drill.
The iron ore is mined over the entire surface of the Moon using the Mining Drill. Iron ore is the most basic type of ore in Stationeers and the most-used one.

Iron ore can be transformed into an iron bar by smelting it in an arc furnace or furnace. It can be melted into a steel spool with carbon and iron ore in an oven that has oxygen and gas from the ice (volatile substances)
Smelting one iron ore gives rise to the following gases:
Gold ore is mined over the entire surface of the Moon using a mining drill.
Smelting one Gold Ore produces the following gases:
Gold ore can be turned into Gold in bars by melting it in an oven or in an arc furnace. Gold ore can also be combined with equal amounts of Silver Ore in the furnace to create Power Tools.

Coal can be used as a low level fuel for generating energy in a solid fuel generator.The carbon can be combined with the iron ore in the furnace to form a steel bar. Using coal as a fuel is not the best idea because it generates pollutants that can be harmful to the Player health, even if it provides a good increase in power. It can also be placed in the reagent processor to make a carbon powder, an element needed for black spray paint.
Created with the help of FURNACE.

Used for smelting ingots and alloys with an oxygen / volatile gas mixture. Ice (oxite) and ice (volatile substances) can be introduced manually into the furnace to produce unpurified gas mixtures or directly extracted as an easy ice melting trick. If the furnace contents are ejected without reaching the required temperature and melt pressure, it will come out as a mixture that can be processed in the centrifuge to recover the raw ores.
The ratio of 1: 1 gold and silver
The ice is extremely sensitive to temperature and sublimes into the gas even with the least exposure to heat - such as holding it in your hand.

The creator of the application is KOL19PL. Its content was based on stationeers-wiki.com and its own experiences. To submit a bug, an update proposal and a proposal write to kol19pl@gmail.com in the title Stationeers.apk
The tablet version is very much impaired

This logic will allow you to automatically keep your atmos temperature within a minimum and maximum temperature without annoying clicking. This setup assumes that your Wall Coolers and Wall Heaters are on a separate network for the room you want to control the temperature of. This also assumes your atmosphere isn\'t highly flammable. Network separation can be obtained through a Transformer or Area Power Controller.
1. Place the Gas Sensor in the middle of the room you want to control
2. Place the Wall Heaters along a wall of the room
3. Place the Wall Coolers along a wall of the room
5. Label the logic reader as Temp Reader
6. Place 1 Kit (Logic Processor) \'Logic Select\' variant for cooling Label this: \"Cooling Select\"
7. Place 1 Kit (Logic Processor) \'Logic Compare\' variant for cooling Label this: \"Cooling Compare\"
8. Place 1 Kit (Logic I/O) \'Batch Writer\' variant Label this: \"Cooling Writer\"
9. Place 1 Kit (Logic Processor) \'Logic Select\' variant Label this: \"Heating Select\"
10. Place 1 Kit (Logic Processor) \'Logic Compare\' variant Label this: \"Heating Compare\"
11. Place 1 Kit (Logic I/O) \'Batch Writer\' variant Label this: \"Heating Writer\"
12.Place all 3 Kit (Logic Memory) units nearby Label these as Temp Min, Temp Midand Temp Maxand set your desired temperatures in kelvin
14. Temp Readershould be set to read Temperaturefrom your Gas sensor
15. Configure your Cooling Select; Select: Cooling CompareInput 1: Max TempInput 2: Mid Temp
16. Configure your Cooling Compare; Input 1: Temp ReaderMode: Greater Input 2: Cooling Select
17. Configure your Cooling Writer; Input: Cooling CompareOutput: Wall Cooler Setting: On
18. Configure your Heating Select; Select: Heating CompareInput 1: Min TempInput 2: Mid Temp
19. Configure your Heating Compare; Input 1: Temp ReaderMode: Less Input 2: Heating Select
20. Configure your Heating Writer; Input: Heating CompareOutput: Wall Heater Setting: On
21. Finally, turn on the logic chips in the following order: Logic Reader Select Unit Logic Compare Batch Writer

This imperfect configuration is a common starting point. It starts with a power of 375 in the morning, builds up to 500w at the zenith (noon), then back to 375. This is due to the fact that the solars only rotate 150 degrees high and that the mathematics of this setting is correct only when rotated by all 180 degrees of the sun\'s angle. This configuration gives the equivalent of 239 W averaged over the whole day / night cycle.

It is a schematic / circuit to perform a timer for other circuits. For example, you can set the cycle to every 10 seconds and another circuit could use it to turn on the warning signal for 2 seconds every 10 seconds.
In this exact implementation, using equality, if for any reason the value exceeds the maximum value, it will never be reset. Commissioning is 85W.
This is the circuit of automatic night lighting that turns on the outdoor lighting at night.
